definition: (Osama) bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: Osama bin Laden was killed, not captured.
sentences.chinese: 奧薩馬本拉登被擊斃而非被捕。

sentences.english: Did bin Laden go to sleep every night thinking The next night they’re coming?
sentences.chinese: 本拉登每晚睡覺的時候都會想‘明晚他們會來嗎？’

sentences.english: The death of Mr. bin Laden is a defining moment in the American-led war on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登之死是美國領導的反恐戰爭的決定性的時刻。

sentences.english: And Zakir might do well to remember what happened to Osama bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 賈基爾最好銘記發生在奧薩馬本拉登身上的一切。

sentences.english: Decentralising was always an integral part of the strategy of bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 去中心化一直都是本拉登戰略的一部分。

sentences.english: They shot and killed him, as well as wounding a woman with him.
sentences.chinese: 他們擊斃了他，也打傷了一爲陪同本拉登的女性。

sentences.english: By removing Osama bin Laden - that does not mean the structure has gone.
sentences.chinese: 除掉奧薩馬本拉登並不意味着組織的消失。

sentences.english: Bin Laden, aged 54, was the founder and leader of al-Qaeda.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登，現年54歲，是基地組織的創始人和領導人。

sentences.english: Some suspect the ISI may even know where Osama bin Laden is hiding.
sentences.chinese: 一些人懷疑ISI甚至可能知曉本拉登的藏身之處。

sentences.english: Bin Laden's then-bodyguard claimed to have delivered the dowry.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登的前保鏢則聲稱，他曾幫忙給新娘家寄過彩禮。

sentences.english: Bin Landen is a bin that laden with rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登是一個裝滿垃圾的垃圾箱。

sentences.english: From there, American officials said, the body was buried at sea.
sentences.chinese: 美國官員表示，本拉登已在阿富汗海葬。

sentences.english: The consequences of his death do so too.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登之死的影響也是如此。

sentences.english: He injected a needle into bin Laden’s body and extracted two bone-marrow samples.
sentences.chinese: 他把一個針管插入本拉登的屍體，取了兩個骨髓樣本。

sentences.english: In some ways, Abbottabad was the ideal hiding place for bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，阿伯塔巴德是本拉登藏匿的理想場所。

sentences.english: Al-Qaida has become, in many ways, a social movement.
sentences.chinese: 在許多方面本拉登成爲了社會的推動者。

definition: Osama bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda
(Osama) bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda
(Colonel Muammar) Gaddafi (1942-2011), de facto leader of Libya from 1969-2011

pinyin: Sa4 da2 mu3 · Hou2 sai4 yin1

definition: US Central Intelligence Agency, CIA/abbr. for 中央情報局|中央情报局[Zhong1 yang1 Qing2 bao4 ju2]
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
